title: George Michael would approve of Last Christmas says Wham!’s Shirlie
text:
George’s music inspired the Last Christmas movie (Picture: AFP, Getty Images)

George Michael would have absolutely approved of his music being used in the upcoming Last Christmas movie, according to former Wham! singer Shirlie Holliman.

Director Paul Feig is bringing the Faith singer’s music to life on the big screen in Last Christmas, a festive rom-com starring Emilia Clarke and Henry Golding and featuring classics from George’s back catalogue.

It couldn’t be more apt for George Michael fans who play Last Christmas on repeat this time of year. The movie’s release will also coincide with the third anniversary of George’s death on Christmas Day in 2016.

Sadly, George isn’t around to see his music bring magic to the love story of Emilia and Henry’s characters Kate and Tom, but a close friend says he would have been thrilled by the mere idea of it.

Shirlie Holliman, who sang as a backing singer for George’s pop group Wham!, told Metro.co.uk: ‘I know it would all have been done with his permission. So I’m sure he had a talk about the movie.

‘It’s lovely to think I’m going into Christmas and can have nice memories of Christmas and his music all around it. I just kind of go by my gut instincts and I do feel really good about this idea of this movie with all his songs in it.’

Shirlie’s husband Martin Kemp added: ‘George was such a Christmas fan. It was his favourite time of the year and so I’m sure he would have loved the idea of it.’

Last Christmas features classic songs from George’s back catalogue

Co-written by actress Emma Thompson, Last Christmas follows shop attendant Kate (Clarke) who bumps into Tom (Golding) by chance and embarks on a romance throughout the festive season.

Basically the perfect Christmas rom-com we all need in our lives.

Shirlie, 58, shared her excitement for the release and said: ‘I love a Christmas movie, I have to say. That’s one of my big things because I don’t like the winter, but I just love everything that is kind of romantic and shiny around Christmas. So I’m really making sure that we go to the premiere as well.’

It’ll make a change to see Emilia in a more, well, non-fantasy role after Game of Thrones ended earlier this year.

And it seems we’re not the only person who will have to try and not picture Emilia in the land of Westeros.

Martin and Shirlie were close friends of George

‘I haven’t seen [the movie yet]. You know, I don’t even want to watch the trailer yet because I love Emilia Clarke,’ Shirlie admitted.

‘I was a massive Game of Thrones fan. So I’ll have to try and get it out of my head that she’s not Daenerys anymore, the Mother of Dragons.

‘I’m really excited about the movie.’

Husband and wife Martin and Shirlie have teamed up to release their first album together, In The Swing Of It, which is set for release on 22 November.

Among the George Michael songs set to feature in Last Christmas, include Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go, Faith, Everything She Wants and, of course, the title track.

Last Christmas hits UK cinemas on 15 November.
